attributes.action: Ban the testing of joined up handwriting in primary school SAT's.
attributes.background: There is currently an epidemic of illegible handwriting in our secondary schools. Primary schools have been forced to cut corners, using a continuous cursive method from Reception to simply tick the boxes of the handwriting statements in the Interim Teacher Assessment Framework.
attributes.additional_details: There is no long term benefit to this; it is simply to meet the Interim Teacher Assessment Framework handwriting statements, which contradicts the handwriting statements in the current National Curriculum. Also, we believe that it should be a statutory requirement that left handed pupils receive specific teaching to meet their needs, to help them master legible handwriting and continue to love writing.

attributes.action: Make thieves liable for their victims insurance for a set amount of time
attributes.background:
I and thousands of people across the country have been victims of theft, be it vehicle, home or personal theft. 

A lot of us feel that the justice system is not helping the victim. We fear going through our insurance company as it affects us by increasing our insurance premium.
attributes.additional_details: There are thousands of car, motorcycle and home thefts throughout the year, admittedly not all the culprits are found, but those that are, and are found guilty in our opinion get away lightly, a fine, a suspended sentence. This doesn't really help the victim who could be put out of pocket by losing their no claims bonus on insurance therefore hitting their pockets again. I would like to make it so all criminals found guilty are liable to pay the victims insurance for a set amount of time.

attributes.action: Article 50 should not be implemented without a debate and vote in parliament.
attributes.background: Implementing The Lisbon Treaty Article 50 will be one of the most important decisions that Britain has made for many years as there will be no going back.  It should not be left to the Executive to make this decision without recourse to parliament for debate and ratification by a vote of all MPs.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/brexit-eu-referendum-leave-article-50-lisbon-treaty-a7100436.html

attributes.action: Replace 5p plastic bags for PAPER BAGS.
attributes.background:
We, students at the School of Social and Behavioural Sciences at Kingston University, would like to see the offer of plastic bags by supermarkets and shopping outlets replaced by PAPER bags instead.
Paper bags can be very sturdy and are eco-friendly. 
Please, join us in our campaign.
attributes.additional_details:
We are also having a competition of art work based on Paper Bags, which will be exhibited at Stanley Picker Gallery (London).
More details about will be available at our Twitter account: @PaperBagsKU

attributes.action: Create and support a Women in Engineering Charter
attributes.background: Theresa May recently celebrated the Women in Finance Charter to tackle gender inequality. The lack of STEM capability in the UK is becoming a crisis, we need to take action to ensure there are opportunities for all. We need a diverse industry to provide infrastructure and services for a diverse UK!
attributes.additional_details:
This is the Women in Finance Charter: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/women-in-finance-charter

Lets replicate this for the engineering, including technology, sector.

attributes.action: Enforce taxi companies to charge accessible taxis the same as inaccessible ones
attributes.background:
A disabled person can end up paying 3 or 4 times more for a taxi journey compared to a non-disabled person. 
The same journey in an accessible taxi was £13.50 whereas friends in an inaccessible taxi were only charged £4.50.
attributes.additional_details:
It is unfair to charge a disabled person more for the same journey because they are disabled. 
Having a disability is already expensive, adding another cost to someone purely because they require a wheelchair (or other mobility aides) is discriminatory. 
The Equality Act 2010 Section 15 states that a person cannot be treated unfavourably because of their disability. 
Therefore I call on the government to change legislation so that disabled people aren't charged more due to their disability.

attributes.action: Increase income tax by 1% and use it to boost NHS funding only.
attributes.background: We are aware that the NHS is facing difficult times.We are fortunate that is has fantastic infrastructure employing a wealth of skilled workers. The NHS directly benefits all of us. Even those with private health insurance employ staff relying on the NHS. We will all benefit from a strong NHS.
attributes.additional_details:
When we or our loved ones are sick, we need the support of the health service and we value the skill and commitment of staff. Nobody likes to wait for hours for appointments, test results or operations, but the service is under strain. The range of treatments is vast and the population is growing.
Every penny each of us puts into the NHS is a way of looking after ourselves and those we love.
Let's have an NHS to feel proud of. I am happy to have two less Starbucks a week to make this happen.

attributes.action: Impose economic sanctions on the USA if they renege on the Paris Climate deal
attributes.background: Climate change is an immediate threat to global ecosystems, livelihoods and communities. The Paris climate agreement is international law and must be fulfilled in order to mitigate dangerous warming. We call for economic sanctions on the USA if they withdraw from the agreement.
attributes.additional_details:
Climate change will rapidly escalate within decades unless urgent action is taken. The USA contribute 16% of global CO2 emissions and must play a leading role in fulfilling the Paris agreement. If the USA withdraw this could lead to catastrophic consequences, with the poorest people in the world suffering the most. If they withdraw, the UK should impose economic sanctions on the USA and encourage its allies to do likewise. 
www.newscientist.com/article/2112164-president-trump-means-we-cant-escape-a-dangerously-warmer-world/ www.scientificamerican.com/article/trump-picks-top-climate-skeptic-to-lead-epa-transition 
www.independent.co.uk/news/science/climate-change-game-over-global-warming-climate-sensitivity-seven-degrees-a7407881.html

attributes.action: Make mental health services more accessible
attributes.background: To make mental health services more accessible the Government should ensure that  no-one who approaches a mental health service should be turned away without help.
attributes.additional_details:
Anyone who goes to their GP or any other health care professional who is experiencing a mental health problem should be automatically referred to the crisis team who should act immediately. The onus should not be on the individual to contact the Crisis Team on their own. There should also always be a one to one therapy option, rather than group therapy.

Many people will know I haven't had an easy time with life or with mental illness; I suffer with depression anxiety PTSD and OCD. Recently, I've hit rock bottom and have screamed for help but have been let down by mental health services who I thought would help, instead they have let me down majorly.

attributes.action: Make HCAs/phlebotomists belong to a professional registered body.
attributes.background: I am a healthcare assistant and a phlebotomist. I started off as a HCA over 4 years ago with no experience. I think that was dangerous. Especially with the care HCAs need to give. Would be nice for all the hard work we learn as we progress, and the care we give, that we belong to a recognised body.

attributes.action: Review effectiveness of the law in protecting consumers from breach of contract
attributes.background: It's illegal to breach a contract but in reality it's very difficult for a consumer to recover their money. The Government needs to investigate how the current law is working and improve protections for consumers.
attributes.additional_details: Both wheelchair users we paid £27,500 for a downstairs disabled toilet & lounge extension. Despite agreeing the contract last April and paying the total in three payments, less than half the contracted work has been done.  We've been informed that it’s unlikely we can get our money back, even using the courts. The Government must investigate how the laws are failing to protect people like us and take action to make them more effective so others don’t have to go through what we have.

attributes.action: Delay the decision to build HS2 until Post Brexit
attributes.background: The UKs  future spending needs to ensure that any government spending supports the UK post Brexit economy.HS2 doesn't benefit the whole of the U.K. The decision to build a second rail system providing marginally faster journey times in to London  needs to be delayed.
attributes.additional_details: Post Brexit future offers  both potential problems & benefits  to the Uk and the government need to delay any decision regarding HS2 until post Brexit and the spending priorities are clearer.A commitment to billions of pounds of spending months before Article 50 is issued on a project criticised by  professionals and public alike  .The decision needs to be delayed .HS2 project even If completed within budget will leave little budget for post Brexit investment in UK business & UK communities.

attributes.action: Carers allowance,Caring for loved ones,by right even if claiming a State Pension
attributes.background: Mandy Bayliffe wanted " The Carers Charter " to protect all Carers from cuts and provide a framework of support via community care free at the point of need. Respite , home support and even sitting Services exempt from any charges or assessment. Many Carers die of exhaustion ,so we have to act now.
attributes.additional_details: There are almost 1.5 million Carers at home who cannot claim the allowance because they are in receipt of a State Pension, which most paid through employment. Go to www.carersassociation.info which shows all the stats in care. The allowance must be paid free of tax or any benefit assessments as with PIPS , when claiming Pension credits or Housing benefits . Child Carers must receive Education credits for when they may wish to move on to College on University . This will help reduce their fees .

attributes.action: Make "critical thinking" a mandatory subject in secondary school.
attributes.background: Critical thinking skills will allow the UK populous to improve their decision making process. Making critical thinking mandatory in schools will lead to future generations being better equipped to question what they are told in terms of facts and feasibility.
attributes.additional_details: The National Council for Excellence in Critical Thinking defines critical thinking as the "intellectually disciplined process of actively and skillfully conceptualizing, applying, analyzing, synthesizing, and/or evaluating information gathered from, or generated by, observation, experience, reflection, reasoning, or communication, as a guide to belief and action."

attributes.action: Separate areas in hospitals for parents suffering a miscarriage or stillbirth
attributes.background: When a woman loses a baby or babies due to either a miscarriage or stillbirth they are placed on a maternity ward to recover. The woman who is grieving is surrounded by women who have just given birth and can hear babies crying. This is very hurtful and noway to help the healing process.
attributes.additional_details: I have personal experience of this and it is heartbreaking being left on a ward with babies crying when you are trying to come to terms with the fact you have just lost your baby. During my experience a midwife had come in the room and congratulated me only to be told that my baby hadn't survived. I believe a separate area would benefit parents and help with the healing process. An area where information could be talked about and not whispered and where midwives could not make a hurtful mistake

attributes.action: We want a General Election before the Government initiates Article 50.
attributes.background:
We agree to the PM’s appeal that we should all ‘come together’ after all, we are supposed to be the UK and not a divisive little England, Wales, Scotland or Northern Ireland.

We have been fed with lies, and propaganda by various parties and media. It is time to get our country’s act together!
attributes.additional_details: Whether it was the result of the PM and her government or not, it is obvious that the country is suffering from, NHS chaos; the fluctuating value of the £ Sterling; the increase in ‘borrowed’ public money; increasing racial ill-feeling against foreign EU workers & immigrants; increasing import costs (particularly food and fuel); strikes & increases of public transport and the public fears & confusion of our future. We need a genuine majority for an election & not a first past the post system.

attributes.action: Allow 16 year olds to vote in Northern Ireland election
attributes.background: After the collapsing of the devolved government in Northern Ireland, it is so important that young people are able to have a say. Yet those who are under 18 still have no voice in our future. 16 year olds were allowed to vote in the Scottish Referendum, so why not the youth of Northern Ireland?
attributes.additional_details: This year marks the 19th anniversary of the Good Friday Agreement, when peace was brought between the Nationalist and Unionist sides in Northern Ireland. Yet for many young people, they are now receiving their first at a time when our politics is in turmoil following the RHI scandal and the breakdown between power-sharing Sinn Fein and DUP. The only way to change this is by giving young people the chance to have their voice heard and move on once and for all for a better future!

attributes.action: Make the Sure Start Maternity Grant Equal to ALL babies!
attributes.background: When having a baby, you're entitled to apply for a Sure Start Maternity Grant.  However if you/partner dont receive benefits you are immediately singled out and unable to claim, therefore stating just because you earn a living you baby does not have the right to an equal £500.00 kick start to life!

attributes.action: Attempted murder for those who have stamped on a victim's head during an assault
attributes.background:
There is a culture of violence that is growing in today's society whereby stamping on someone's head is perfectly normal during an assault. 

This is literally trying to kill. Anyone who claims they don't think it is life threatening is a liar. 

Those who do it, do it often
attributes.additional_details:
I am seeing more and more cases of people being seriously injured, disfigured, left with brain damage and killed because of this accepted culture of violence.

Such attacks are clearly life threatening. I myself have had my skull broken in half from such an attack but was lucky enough to not have any visible damage.

Those who have been proven to stamp on a victim's head should be subjected to a mandatory attempted murder charge. This is the only way to stop it before it gets any worse.

attributes.action: Make tools VAT exempt for PAYE employed tradesman
attributes.background: Many workers employed in different trades are required to purchase and maintain their own hand tools and tool storage. It is unfair and unreasonable that there should be VAT levied on such items as they are not purchased for want but out of necessity

attributes.action: Make Christmas Day & Boxing Day family time not business time
attributes.background: We should go back 14 years ago when christmas day and boxing day when everything was closed and all family spent time together. These days it's about business and who can make more money. Not family time whats so ever. I've got son nearly two years old but have to spend christmas day at work.
attributes.additional_details:
Every one using this two days for a business does not care about families with small children, old people.

At least from 365 days these two days everything should be closed.

attributes.action: Introduce more tax for Buy To Let Landlords and Foreign Property Investors
attributes.background:
Homes are for living in, they are not pension pots. Prices are now ridiculous, driven up by greedy investors. Politicians fear losing elections if house prices fall, yet high prices do not even benefit them either.
Bring down house prices now!
attributes.additional_details:
Wages not in line with rising house prices. Drastic change is needed.
The entire economy should not be functioning on house prices.

attributes.action: Make chrons disease a disability
attributes.background: Its hard to get out most days as when you have this disease you are constantly on the toilet.You cant even get out of bed most days your belly hurts that much it feels like you are in labour 24/7 please help us we all look fine on the outside but feel so bad on the inside.

attributes.action: Make the Work Capability Assessment illnesss specific
attributes.background: The Work Capability Assessments for the past five years have been heavily directed towards physical disability which is irrelevant to those suffering from mental illnesses. This makes it almost impossible for anybody with a mental illness to be assessed accordingly.
attributes.additional_details: Examples of the assessments carried out for all claimants, regardless of their condition, be it mental or physical include: reaching, standing and sitting, absence or loss of control of the bowel, consciousness during waking moments and picking up or moving and transferring. This is part of a long list of many assessments which do not relate to mental illness. This has meant that people with mental health problems, signed off work by a doctor and or psychiatrist are often declared fit for work, resulting in a decline in their health and often suicide. We ask that the assessments are specific to the disability of the claimant in order to obtain a fair assessment of that individual's disability.

attributes.action: Make parking on pavement illegal so we wheelchair and pramchairs get through
attributes.background: When people have parked on pavement. We,  disabled with all sorts of wheelchair  can't get through to the narrow gap between the pavement and wall on the narrow street. That's including all sorts of pushchairs and pramchairs. So make it illegal by parking their cars on pavement anywhere in the UK

attributes.action: Ban pictures of children from online dating/sexual encounter profiles
attributes.background: At present it isn't illegal to put pictures of your children on dating websites/apps intended to facilitate sexual meets. There is nothing the police or social services can do if this occurs and persons use pictures of their children to aid their dating breaching the child's rights/privacy+safety.
attributes.additional_details:
As a mother who has recently had her children recognised in the street due to the father using pics of the children on online sex apps I want change.

I have spoken to the police and social services and it isn't an offence to use pictures on these post 18 sites.

It is illegal for children to have social media yet parents can put them in the public domain to help obtain sexual partners.

Legally! Please can we act together to get this discussed in parliament - children's safety is critical!

attributes.action: child sex offenders not be allowed to apply for contact with their own children
attributes.background: After so many families having to deal with their child being sexually abused, I think that no family should have the added pressures and stress of the abusers applying for contact with any child they have parental responsibility for until investigations completed and sentences have been spent.
attributes.additional_details: 80% of child sexual abuse victims under 16 are abused by a family friend, family member or a person known to the family. These child sex offenders have a "right" to apply for contact with children they have parental responsibility for. This is wrong and change MUST happen now!!

attributes.action: Urban and suburban trees need protecting as if they were in a conservation area
attributes.background: Urban and suburban trees are not protected by the current system of getting Tree Preservation Orders for those under threat. The first thing that the community know about any threat is the chainsaws moving in and the trees disappearing. When the Tree Officer arrives, all that is left is the stump.
attributes.additional_details:
Giving all urban and suburban trees the same protection would give the Tree Officer time to visit vulnerable trees and make some decision on their amenity value to the whole community
We all deserve to enjoy trees as we walk to school, do our shopping and go about our daily lives, not just those lucky enough to be living in a conservation area. 
Ref : Trees in the Townscape - A Guide for Decision Makers   by ﻿The Trees and Design ﻿﻿Action﻿﻿ Group (﻿﻿TD﻿﻿AG)  www.tdag.org.uk

attributes.action: Make wrongful online doxing a criminal offence
attributes.background: Many people, often children, have their private details leaked online. This may include their phone number, address, or even personal photos. This is a form of cyber bullying if the person did not give permission for their details to be leaked. It is essential for this online attack to be illegal.
attributes.additional_details:
www.studyweb.com/doxing/
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doxing
www.gohacking.com/what-is-doxing-and-how-it-is-done/

attributes.action: Call on UK government to stop dealing immediately with Sudan Government
attributes.background: Based on testimony from caregivers and survivors, Amnesty International estimates that more than 200 people may have died as a result of exposure to the chemical weapons agents, with many being children.The majority of survivors of the chemical weapons attacks have had no access to medical care.
attributes.additional_details:
An Amnesty International investigation has gathered horrific evidence of the repeated use of what are believed to be chemical weapons against civilians, including very young children, by Sudanese government forces in one of the most remote regions of Darfur over the past eight months.
Please take an action to end this aggression and dangerous crimes of Sudan Government.

https://www.amnesty.org/en/latest/news/2016/09/sudan-credible-evidence-chemical-weapons-darfur-revealed/

attributes.action: Change the legal rights to identifying information regarding adoptions.
attributes.background:
Due to the UK Adoption Laws birth families have no legal rights to identifying information regarding adoptions. 
The only options is to use an Intermediary Agent or to place your name on the Adoption Contact Register hoping the adoptee has already put their name on it, or will do in the future.
attributes.additional_details:
We want to change these laws so that birth families can access the details of their adopted children/siblings.
We propose the following;
The birth family to be able to obtain the  adoption certificate, which shows the name the adoptee, was given after adoption including the adoptive parents names.
County the adoption occurred.
In the first instance the biological parents can obtain these documents.
Siblings to also have the rights to apply for the same information.

attributes.action: Stop ticket sites selling direct to partner sites before the public get a chance
attributes.background: Ticket sites are selling to partner 3rd party sites before the public get a chance to buy, the tickets are then sold at inflated prices meaning it's difficult for people to get to see events they want to go to, it's time the government stepped in and put a stop to it
attributes.additional_details: U2 tickets this morning being sold as soon as they were realeased on sale, on seat wave for £300 each, this isn't the first time but this has made me start this petition as it's time the government put a stop to it, modern day touting electronically is worse then the man on the street touting

attributes.action: Cap insurance cancellation and ammendment charges to a reasonable admin fee only
attributes.background: After cancelling a policy for motor insurance having changed my vehicle I was charged a fee of I've £97 to cancel my policy. The price of the policy was only £277 to begin with, I this charge is completely unfair and unreasonable and feel a cap on these charges is required an admin fee of £25?

attributes.action: I wish the Home Office to review the case of a Fijian soldier Semesa Maiyale.
attributes.background: Semesa Maiyale known as Sam joined the British army in 2003 and served with the Kings Own Scottish Borders and then the Royal Regiment of Scotand serving nine years,completed tours of Iraq and was promised the right to remain in the Uk after his service ended.
attributes.additional_details: Sam was discharged in 2012, Sam has no right to work, cannot claim benefits or housing and is supported by his partner who as a staff nurse is having to provide for the both of them and their son. sam rightly feels betrayed and let down.

attributes.action: Compulsory Mindfulness in all Primary Schools
attributes.background: The current education system is destroying our children;it is a system driven by standardised assessments.This is not the education our children need; they need a system that is concerned about their mental wellbeing, not just test scores. The statistics for children's mental health are overwhelming
attributes.additional_details: 1 in 10 children aged between 5-16years has a mental health problem.It is predicted that mental health illness is to be one of the major health burdens of the coming decade.We have a social responsibility for the wellbeing of the next generation.The system is not going to change, but compulsory MINDFULNESS for all primary children could provide them with vital tools to protect their mental wellbeing. Mindfulness has been shown to reduce stress,anxiety and bad behaviour and improve self-esteem.

attributes.action: Pressure Myanmar's government to stop the genocide against the Rohingya people
attributes.background: Decades of discrimination and dehumanisation of the Rohingya, an ethnic minority in Myanmar, has ultimately led to genocidal violence from political and religious leaders since 2012, which "may amount to crimes against humanity". The country's leader, a Nobel Peace Prize Laureate, sits idly by.
attributes.additional_details:
Described by the UN as "the world's most persecuted minority", the Rohingya are an ethnic minority who have lived in Myanmar's Arakan state for generations. They were stripped of citizenship in 1982 and are victims of gross human rights violations.

We urge the UK government to pressure the Myanmar government to:
•Allow humanitarian and medical aid into the affected areas
•Allow the UN unrestricted access to conduct their investigations
•Recognise Rohingya as an official ethnic minority

attributes.action: Revise/Abolish stamp duty rules for first-time property buyers.
attributes.background: First time buyers (FTBs) should not have to pay stamp duty, the legacy agreement whereby this tax was relieved for FTBs should be reinstated. This would alleviate the financial challenges that FTBs face when attempting to get on the housing ladder which is further exacerbated in the South East
attributes.additional_details: There have been Government schemes introduced that are supposed to offset/assist FTBs entering the market however these are grossly prejudice to the London area and elsewhere in the UK. Outer Fringe areas of London have inflated housing markets due to their attractive location for commuting but schemes like the Help-to-Buy & Save-to-Buy have limits of £250,000 which is significantly below the average house price in areas such as Essex.

attributes.action: Make learning and understanding about disabilities part of the curriculum.
attributes.background: As a mother of a young child who has Autism it's a topic close to my heart. We will encounter people from all backgrounds around the world in life that will have a disability. Teaching our youth of today about disabilities and how we are all equal instead of growing up with no knowledge/awareness.
attributes.additional_details: In current curriculum there's areas that need a helping hand. I'm sure that many will agree that there's alot of unhelpful information you received that didn't really help you in 'real' life. By signing this petition your giving people who haven't got a voice a chance to push for a cause that I feel should have always been in place. Why aren't we made aware of disabilities and how we can help others. "Bless those that see the world through a different window and those who understand their view"

attributes.action: Government to demonstrate U.K. will be better off prior to triggering Article 50
attributes.background: The EU referendum resulted in mass country divide with origins from substandard facts. To reassure the UK, the government must publicise robust data & timeframes to prove the UK will be better off (short & long term) including, GDP, inflation, employment, human rights & national security

attributes.action: Create a database for those who would like to remain EU citizens after Brexit
attributes.background: The EU referendum shows that 48.11% of voters chose to remain in the EU. Many people who didn't vote have since said that they wish to remain, plus 'Brexiters' who claim to have been misinformed. Give the EU an exact figure of people willing to keep their citizenship if it were offered to them.
attributes.additional_details: The European Parliament's chief negotiator has confirmed that EU negotiators will offer Brits an individual opt-in to remain EU citizens. Show that we want this deal and that Teresa May does NOT speak for us, we speak for ourselves!

attributes.action: Stop aid to countries that have a nuclear/space program put monies saved in NHS
attributes.background: Billions are sent abroad to foreign countries that have nuclear or space programs or both. And our own NHS doesnt have enough funds to survive. Pakistan received over £300.000.0000 from the UK whilst spending millions on their space and nuclear ambitions. Let's readjust and help our NHS .
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/magazine-34176846
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/magazine-12607537
http://news.sky.com/story/ae-departments-fail-to-hit-waiting-times-for-16-months-nhs-figures-show-10725757

attributes.action: Review the lack of increases in Carers Allowance for full time carers.
attributes.background:
According to a recent survey, carried out by the Carers Trust, caring for sick and/or disabled family members is taking its toll on the health of the nations unpaid carers.

This is going to lead to a care crisis in this country as well as be a massive drain on the NHS.
attributes.additional_details:
A carer needs to look after someone for a minimum 35 hours a week, in order, to receive Carers Allowance of £62.10, that`s just £1.78 an hour or less which is far below the National Living Wage and has not been increased the way pensions have.

With the effect of Austerity policies meaning that financial support for carers in the form of Council Tax and Housing benefit having been slashed we are now struggling to survive and we're forced back into part-time work to survive.

We need action now.

attributes.action: Abolish or reduce Vehicle Excise Duty (Road Tax) for Motorcycles
attributes.background: As most Motorcycles cover minimal annual mileage, have low emissions, help reduce congestion and do little damage to roads, it is unfair that owners have to pay between £17 and £82 tax per year whilst a significant number of cars pay none and many paying only £30 per year.

attributes.action: Make sign language compulsory from infants at school.
attributes.background: Anyone can become deaf in their lifetime. Surely if more people can sign language people that are deaf or people with special needs adhd or autism that use forms of signs such as makaton to communicate won't feel so isolated.
attributes.additional_details: Children are like a sponge when soaking up knowledge. So if makaton which is an easier form.of sign language is introduced to children at a young age, it would mean that we would eventually all be able to.communicate at some point in life with someone who uses sign language every day. It means future generations can go ask that child thats sat on their own in the playground to come and play with them. They will be able to.communicate, instead of not knowing how to and the child not left isolated no more.

attributes.action: A Parliamentary review of the 2005 Change to the Double Jeopardy Law.
attributes.background: We believe the operation of the change in the the DJ law is not working as Parliament intended. We cite the example of Matthew Hamlen, a 37 year old electrician, and a married man with a son, currently in the custody of HMPS in the UK having been sentenced to 30 years imprisonment in February 2016.
attributes.additional_details:
Matthew has strenuously and consistently denied any involvement both before and during his original trial in 2011/2012 , at which he was unanimously acquitted by the jury, and his later ‘double jeopardy’ trial in January and Feb  2016.

https://matthewhamlenisinnocent.wordpress.com

attributes.action: Stronger sentences for paedophilia.
attributes.background: we're looking into making it law that individuals who commit paedophilia & are found guilty are not allowed to live within a radius of 1000 feet of a school or playground. Due to a recent conviction of a paedophile who lives very close to a primary school in a residential area.
attributes.additional_details: Due to a recent conviction of a paedophile who lives very close to a primary school in a residential area. Who got a incredibly light sentence of 8 months suspended over 2 years for viewing images and videos of children from babies upwards. In America it is law that any convicted sex offender is not to live within 1000 feet of a school we feel this should aslo be a law in the UK.
attributes.creator_name: dominic and coralie james & paul and kelly wait

attributes.action: Expand the Syrian refugee resettlement programme and increase aid.
attributes.background: The government should increase its pledge to resettle 20 000 Syrian refugees by 2020 as well as increase aid to help millions affected by the crisis.
attributes.additional_details:
While several Middle-Eastern nations have taken in millions of Syrian refugees, as well European countries such as Germany taking in hundreds of thousands so far, the UK government has pledged to resettle only 20 000, by 2020.

The US president has signed an executive order to ban Syrian refugees indefinitely, which will likely result in civilian deaths that could be avoided. One of the best responses from the UK to show its opposition would be to increase its pledge and increase aid.

attributes.action: Jeremy Hunt to work a shift on A&E explaining to patients why he's failed us all
attributes.background: We think that Jeremy Hunt should work a shift in any overcrowded A&E Department this winter and go round to every patient, nurse, doctor, ambulance crew and explain how he prepared for this winter and how he's failed us all.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for motorised vehicles to park or wait in cycle lanes.
attributes.background:
Cycle lanes can help increase confidence for cyclist with a designated part of the road, either by having it separate from roads of with road markings.
When vehicles park or wait in a cycle lane, it not only makes the cycle lane pointless, it actually increases the risks to cyclists.
attributes.additional_details:
A cycle lane gives a cyclist a little more confidence, especially for newer cyclists.
Cycle lanes that have vehicles in them are not only a waste of money and resources, but dangerous to cyclist and moving vehicles. 
The cyclist has to go further into the road in an area where a cycle lane was deemed to be needed.
What is the point in having cycle lanes that are unusage by cyclists because they are full of parked cars?

attributes.action: Take care of our Homeless before  housing  20,000 Syrian Refugees
attributes.background: The Government have announced that local authorities have found enough properties to house 20,000 Syrian Refugees,
attributes.additional_details: This is disgusting we have homeless people including ex members of the armed forces who have fought for this country who have nowhere to live and yet they want to home people from abroad who have never paid anything into the system getting not only free houses but no doubt benefits that we pay for as well
